title: New practice
body: Lovely practice, very quick and efficient when I went for my vaccine, I was in and out quickly. Nice new modern building, seems very hygienic.

title: First Class Experience
body: Visited the Ossett clinic to have my 2nd Cataract operation and was, once again, treated in a thoroughly professional and personal manner. Nothing was too much trouble and all the procedures were clearly explained. An tremendously enjoyable experience carried out by enthusiastic and highly professional staff. Thank you so much.

title: Brilliant practice
body: Would like to thank the surgery for their support over the years, especially recently. They listened and didn’t blame my weight for my issues, not that I’m particularly overweight but I know of some people at different surgeries who can’t get help because of their weight even if it’s a side effect (like for me). They took action and pushed referrals making the process much quicker and easier, but was also there when I had a bit of a breakdown when I was unable to cope. They have also helped my partner who has really struggled with his health for the past 18 months and felt they’ve gone above and beyond for us

title: Thank you
body: Passed what look like blood this morning..phoned the surgery 11..Doctor phoned back within a couple of hours..Appointment made for 4pm...seen and various tests done and sent off... Absolutely quality service in such a professional manner..we are so lucky to have such a surgery..Whatever the outcome makes you feel so much calmer the quick and caring manner in which I was dealt with. Please note I include Reception in this review..Im so sorry I didnt catch the name of the Doctor...Apologies ..

author: Keeen88
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My experience in orthopaedics ward
body: I have had a 1st class experience on this ward. I was brought in to get my hip replaced after a fall at home. We phoned for an ambulance to take me in and waited quite a long time for them to get to me due to understaffing in the service. Although when they arrived I was reassured and felt comfortable in their care. They took me to A&E where I didn't have to wait long at all for a bed and I was grateful for this. I think communication between the staff and myself has been outstanding and I never feel afraid to ask questions as I know the staff are willing to answer in as much detail as they can. I honestly can't complain about any element of my stay. The staff are so kind and helpful and are willing to assist me in anyway they can, even in terms of pain relief they have been so good at managing my treatment and care so that I can feel as comfortable as possible. My surgeon was extremely informative and explained every element of my operation to me in great detail. In terms of the ward itself I am fortunate enough to have my own side room which I am very happy with. Overall I really don't have anything negative to say and I am very grateful for all the staff who so far have done such a great job.

readBy.name: Northern Ireland ambulance service
Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Keeen88
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My A&E experience
body: I was rushed to A& E after taking a stoke and the staff have been brilliant. I have been in this A& E ward for a day and a half and so far everything has been communicated to me so so well. I feel listened to and know I can ask the staff anything and they would be more than willing to help me out. When I was first taken in, the beds in the area which I was treated were not very comfortable but I feel comfortable and safer now I have been moved to this side of the A& E unit and will be waiting here another while until I get a bed up in the ward. I don't think there is anything I could suggest as an improvement, all the staff have been angels.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Public Health Agency

author: Keeen88
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: I know I will be treated well
body: My stay has been so so good. Communication is outstanding from both doctors and nurses. I have no fear in asking questions as I know the staff are more than willing to sort me out with anything. I arrived via the ambulance service which was good and fast and I was actually quite surprised as I thought I would have had a longer wait. The staff have all been so good, the nurses especially. Its just really nice to have nice people around when your recovering. I feel fortunate to have a side room off the rest of the ward which is lovely and bright and I am really enjoying it. I feel everyone has been more than kind to me and from now on based on this experience so far I won't mind if I have to come back into hospital as I know I will be treated well.

readBy.name: Northern Ireland ambulance service
Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Keeen88
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My experience in 4 north surgical ward
body: One thing I would say about my experience is that waiting times, not only in A& E but also in terms of scans and bloods, have been terrible although I can't fault any other part of my stay. Staff have been amazing and their communication skills are second to none. Its not the staff who need changed or improved its the system that needs big Big changes. Understaffing is the issue here.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021

author: Keeen88
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Good care but long waits
body:
In terms of my own injury I am shocked at how little time it took me to do so much damage. Although from admission the staff have been tremendous and they aren't praised enough. My injury is a broken ankle which I got through falling at home. Frustratingly I had a 4 hour wait on the ambulance service to get to me which meant I had to lie on the floor in extreme pain for such a long time. I think the undertstaffing of the ambulance service is outrageous and needs to be sorted. The 2 ambulance staff on where the only 2 ambulance crew covering my area that day and they were never off their feet. When they arrived they were so apologetic about my wait and I found it completely understandable as it's not them who are failing to provide the appropriate care, it's the system. They couldn't do enough for me and made me feel reassured and comfortable on my way to hospital. I am very happy with this service.  
They brought me into A&E where I had to wait a ridiculously long time to be seen. The place was packed and the lack of space made me frustrated, it was unbearable. When I eventually got an x-Ray the staff were so lovely, kind and helpful. I have currently been in a week and am waiting for my swelling to go down before I can get operated on which is a bit of a disaster but that's my body's fault.  
At the minute I am in a lot of pain but the staff are doing their best for me. To be honest some explanation may be lacking in terms of my treatment as I would like to know a bit more about exactly what's going on with my treatment and care as well as what the future may look like for me. Finally I am very glad to have a room on my own which is bright and airy and I enjoy looking out onto the greenery, spending so long lying up unable to move I do get very bored so I am glad I can see out.

readBy.name: Northern Ireland ambulance service
Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Public Health Agency

author: Treyj95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My experience in the A&E department
body: I have been in and out of the hospital for approximately 100 days and during this time I have felt the staff to be extremely attentive, diligent and kind. They work extremely hard and are failed at system level with the pressures and business they have to deal with. I am extremely content that I can ask any of the nurses on the ward a question and everything has been well communicated with me throughout my time in hospital. I really appreciate this as it can be daunting going through hospital unaware of what is going on in regards to your treatment. I am comfortable in my ward and feel I have sufficient privacy to get on with my reading. The only thing I could criticise with regards to my stay is the waiting time I experienced from my arrival in the A&E department to me getting a bed. I came in at 6pm and did not receive a bed until 3.30 am. It was a long wait which is frustrating however I understand there are sicker patients ahead of me and it is not the fault of the staff. Overall my experience has been positive as a whole and I take comfort in knowing that when I am admitted to hospital I will be well looked after.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: asteropeef99
authorRole: the patient
title: Women's unit
body: I had a c-section and my baby breathing was a little fast, the Dr's were not to worried but had said this ward will take extra care of you and your baby and keep a close monitor. However, I have a phobia of lifts and climbed two flight of stairs to come up to this ward. When I arrived it was a cubicle and it was a four bed. I had asked the midwife who escorted me up if I can have the window side as its warm and it was only me and another patient in room. They said they would let them know and they will change it around. The bed in that cubicle was not made. I called the buzzer and asked the nurse as I had been waiting and in pain how long will it be so, I can move and settle there instead of geting all my belongings out here as I'm struggling and in pain. The staff member did not change the sheets for the bed and refused and said it can be 2-3 hours as they were busy, Bearing in mind this is a staff member who will be looking after me and my baby. I found them very rude and did not co-operate. To some it up, to me this is not a high care unit and I did not feel treated fairly and the found the staffare arrogant and did not help. My baby was not given meds on time and did not get them until I buzzed to ask why. The night staff that I came across were a disgrace. I've had a major surgery I'm in pain and they want me to keep making my baby feeds in the kitchen myself and if I asked them for help they would behave awkward and make faces. I felt so scared here and did not feel safe at all.

readBy.name: Bradford Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Keeen88
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Good care but some improvements needed
body: I have come into hospital for an operation. I started my hospital experience in A& E which was a questionable time. The staff in A& E were more than good to me but the wait was horrendous and is something that needs to be worked on in order to provide the best care for the patient. The hospital staff are honestly amazing and they take time  to chat to me both about my care and my life in general which is a really nice touch. Any questions I have had are all answered in detail. The ward in general is a clean space and I feel comfortable and safe here. Although one thing I would say, on days like this when the temperature is so hot a fan is definitely needed as the temperature on the ward can get unpleasant. All in all my experience has been good.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021

author: likeablesr84
authorRole: the patient
title: Lack of midwifery care during labour
body:
I had my daughter at Medway Maritime which I chose especially after researching and finding their great reviews and awards.  
I’m so thankful that I had a healthy baby because the care I received whilst on the labour ward was minimal. If there had been anything wrong with the baby I do not trust that it would have been handled well. I came away feeling like we might as well have gone to Premier Inn to have the baby as I basically was put in a room and left to it.  
This was my second baby and I had always planned to have an epidural for the birth - when I called ahead I told them this. As soon as I arrived at the hospital having contractions I told the midwives I'd like an epidural - they looked at each other blankly and then went off to a staff area whilst I stood there at reception having painful contractions.  
Eventually I was taken to a room, checked and told I was 3cm dilated. I really think this is unlikely as I was 3cm dilated 2 days earlier at my midwife check up and now I was heavily contracting!  
Anyway that was it - me in this room in so much pain, with my husband, and I thinking I sure hope the anaesthetist gets here soon. My husband had to keep going out to find the midwife to ask her for any updates. She would come into the room and just say "no sorry he’s busy in surgery" and then just stand there watching me have a contraction silently and then leave.  
She never checked me again and I had to ring the emergency alarm when in all honesty I thought I was going to poo! I told her this when she came in and she stood there with her hand cupped under my anus whilst I bent over the bed in pain. At no point did she say, you’re actually having the baby now, let’s get you in position.  
Another midwife came in, who I'd never seen before, and it was her that said why don’t you get on the bed so we don’t drop the baby onto the floor and that was when I knew the baby was actually coming! (This was an hour after being told I was 3cm dilated and left then alone.)  
I was not supported one bit - not informed about what was happening to me let alone given any ‘you’re doing really well’ or ‘it’s time to push when you feel the contractions’. I feel that I did it alone, with my poor husband helplessly watching the shock on my face.  
After the birth I sat in a blood soaked gown on the blood soaked bed for two hours waiting to birth the placenta. I don’t know why I didn’t ask for the sheets to be changed but I was quite shell shocked by my experience.  
When it came time for a shift changeover the new midwife came in and said oh dear let’s get you cleaned up and change these sheets. She was very lovely and I wish I’d had her for the birth.  
I had a beautiful baby girl who was healthy and passed all the tests and we were ready to go home by 1pm. We didn’t make it out the door until 8pm because we were waiting on the results of a final blood test for me, which it transpired they lost the blood sample for and had to do again.  
If I have another baby, I would NEVER go to this hospital!

readBy.name: Medway NHS Foundation Trust

author: Treyj95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Caring and helpful staff
body: I have been in hospital for 4 weeks and have been extremely impressed with the staff. They have been so caring and helpful. I never feel afraid to ask a question or request something. I feel comfortable in the ward I am in and safe in my surroundings. I am on a liquid diet as I have trouble swallowing and I believe that the food is good. The nurses and staff regularly bring tea which I really appreciate however I believe the cups are  little bit too small. This is just a minor criticism  and me nit picking. Overall the staff are great and my stay in hospital has been positive.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Treyj95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff were kind, helpful and attentive
body: I came into Craigavon hospital via an ambulance which then arrived at the A& E department. There was minimal delay getting an ambulance which was good as it meant I was seen to very quickly. I also managed to get a bed on the female urology ward quickly which was positive and I could settle into my surroundings. The staff were kind, helpful and attentive and I cannot think of any negative comments I could make about the service I have been provided with during my stay in hospital. I feel my stay has been as positive as it could be.

readBy.name: Northern Ireland ambulance service
Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Keeen88
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Communication skills are amazing
body: I am in with atrial flutter. What sticks out to me most is the efficiency of the staff its so admirable. The doctors and nurses communication skills are amazing and it offers me so much reassurance as I am never afraid to ask a question. I was brought through A& E which for me was quite a pleasant experience. It was unbelievably fast and within half an hour I was treated. I got my bed up in this ward so quickly and don't think my treatment could be any better. I am very very grateful for my treatment and I want to give a huge thanks to all the staff I've seen so far.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: joyous angel
authorRole: a relative
title: We left feeling very positive
body:
I accompanied my husband as his GP referred him to Urology as his PSA is higher than he would like. We were seen exactly at the appointment time.  
After examination the Dr. took great care to explain the pros and cons of what could happen from now on. He gave my husband the choice of 'wait and see' for 4 months and monitor PSA then, or go ahead with MRI and biopsy - explaining the possible downsides of biopsy.  
My husband decided to adopt the 'wait and see'. We left feeling very positive and appreciated being seen within 10 days of referral, by a kind and caring Dr.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Keeen88
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My experience in A&E  CAH
body: The staff have all been so pleasant and I couldn't fault anyone. Everything about my experience has been so good. Thankfully I have never had a long wait for any services this time. In terms of my ward I am so comfortable and feel safe. I get more than enough privacy at the minute. The ambulance service took me in and they have been very good. Again I didn't have to wait on them long at all and their communication skills were amazing as they left me into A&E feeling reassured.

readBy.name: Northern Ireland ambulance service
Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: bb123
authorRole: a service user
title: Little to no confidence now
body:
In early pregnancy I experienced some bleeding. I contacted my midwife in the morning to be met with an answering machine, finally received a call back at 5.28pm that I missed informing me they finish at 5.30 and if it was an emergency I was to call the hospital. I hadn’t yet met with my midwife so had no clue about any other numbers. Contacted again the following day and received a phonecall back at 5.25pm, explained my situation and was told that it's normal, and to try not to worry. Unsure how someone over the phone can triage you in less than a minute. Turns out my bleeding was the loss of one of my babies.  
Another phone call to inform them of symptoms I was experiencing, was just told they weren't sure and to call my GP. Thankfully my GP is actually more than helpful when it comes to offering advice.Fast forward a couple of weeks and I have been in contact with my midwife again to ask a question regarding contact with someone unwell - I’m yet to receive a telephone call back 3 days later. I was advised to avoid Google, however this is my only option at this point!It’s a worrying time being pregnant and to feel like you’ve got little to no support fills me with 0 confidence going forward.  
Also half the questions I answered at my booking in appointment were either wrong or just not filled out and had to be repeated when I attended my hospital appointment.

readBy.name: NHS Lanarkshire
Healthcare Improvement Scotland
North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership
Partnership for Change

author: magpieey44
authorRole: the patient
title: Overdue Appointment for coil removal
body: Due to the covid pandemic, my coil removal had expired by 18 months. My GP no longer provided the service, so was advised to contact the clinic. At the clinic the staff were very pleasant and the whole procedure was stress free, all my questions were explained in a clear manner and the clinic was very covid secure. I definitely would recommend this service.

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust

author: Treyj95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff really put me at ease
body: I came to the A& E department following a faint this morning. I was seen to quickly and given a bed within 3 hrs. I feel that all staff listened to me and explained what was going on. They provided good direction so I didn't ever feel in the dark about what was happening with regards to my treatment. I have been in hospital many times over the years and can honestly say that the nurses and doctors have always been kind and helpful. The nurses who have looked after me this time are extremely thoughtful and attentive as they usually are. I am beyond grateful for this as coming into hospital without my husband or daughter with me is quite daunting however I feel the staff really put me at ease. The experience as a whole has been positive so far.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: augusthh36
authorRole: the patient
title: Coil Removal
body: The nurses were amazing, made me feel comfortable, talked me through the process and made what I was extremely nervous about seem really easy. Thank you!

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust

author: Umadilla
authorRole: a service user
title: A revelation
body:
I had some horrible symptoms downstairs. I was booked in for an appointment to fit within my work schedule. The telephone staff were understanding and cordial.
The appointment was prompt and without delay. Both doctor and nurse were understanding, ensuring I felt comfortable while guiding me through diagnosis and treatment.
I just wanted to take the time to give thanks and praise for the staff that make this service what it is; invaluable.

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust

author: whisperem47
authorRole: a service user
title: Assessment and Diagnosis
body: The staff were very supportive and helpful. The staff I saw yesterday were Caring and professional. They took their time to alleviate my worries.

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust

author: Keeen88
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Their communication has been amazing
body:
The nurses are brilliant and their communication to me has been amazing. You honestly can't beat the nursing staff here in craigavon. Although from first hand experience I feel that that some senior staff could maybe be improved as I feel they are always very rushed and don't have much time for me. The nurses are so good at reassuring me and I value their opinion.  
Overall the ward is dead on but the beds aren't one bit comfortable which is a downside.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Treyj95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I was disappointed with the standard of care
body:
I came in through the A&E department experiencing chest pain at 7.30 pm and was not seen until 5.30 am. I was disappointed with the standard of care as if I had been having a heart attack from the chest pain, I could have died before I had been seen to. I felt I was going around in circles in the A&E department and was moved between corridors and wards whilst still not having any contact with medical staff. The only staff I encountered were administrative staff which I found shocking, given the symptoms I came in with. I do however recognise that this is a problem not at hospital level but at system level and the individual members of the medical team working were superb. On one occasion I had requested more pain relief and was told that this was not possible as I had missed it. I questioned this and felt frustrated as I could not have possibly missed my dose of medication considering I had been lying in the same bed all day. I was disappointed with the miscommunication between staff which meant I was not given the medication I feel I should have been given.  
They provided fantastic care as soon as I made it to the cardiology ward. The nurses and doctors were attentive and kind. They are all extremely hard working and I would like to emphasise that failures of the service are as a result of problems at the system level compared to individual staff members. The care provided was efficient and has meant I have been able to return home sooner.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Public Health Agency

author: Keeen88
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: There was little to no water offered to me
body:
I originally came into A& E yesterday but it was so extremely busy. I was so dehydrated in the heat that after 7 hours without being seen I decided to go home and try again tomorrow. There was little to no water offered to me yesterday and nothing available to buy in the shop. When I got home I felt so light headed and dehydrated I drank 2 litres of water. At home I also decided to call an out of hours doctor to see if they might be able to help me but to my surprise there was no doctors available and I could only chat to a nurse, this was extremely unfortunate and I was very very frustrated.  
I returned again to A& E early this morning and have been waiting ever since although I have noted that today the staff aren't under as much pressure. I feel there is a great lack of communication between myself and the staff and I have not been regularly updated regarding what's happening with my care. But I do understanding there is a lot of pressure on the system and by looking at the staff around me I know they really are trying their very best to help. Hopefully, I don't need to wait much longer to be seen.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Brian H
authorRole: a relative
title: Excellent service from a student
body:
After reading about the passion and determination of hospital staff during Covid-19, I was amazed and inspired like everyone. I felt distant from the healthcare community, as fortunately I or a family member, have never experienced any major health problems.  
This all changed however in June 2021. My 86 year old grandmother, who has dementia, was admitted to hospital with blood poisoning. The care she received from a staff member named Frankie, was nothing short of exceptional. She started every day with a smile as Frankie would regale her every morning with the famous ‘Glasgow patter’ over a cup of tea.  
He took time and effort to discuss my mother’s memories of growing up in the Highlands, and by the end of it, my mother was laughing every day. The time he took to speak to my mother will be appreciated forever. Myself and my two brothers, will always discuss the positive impact he had on her.  
I just want to thank Frankie for how he treated my grandmother and I now have even more admiration for NHS staff. Thank you Frankie, and thank you all at Kirkcaldy Hospital for being such inspirational figures.

readBy.name: Office of Annabelle Ewing, MSP for Cowdenbeath
Fife Health & Social Care Partnership
NHS Fife

author: Lou231
authorRole: a service user
title: Care in paediatric ward
body:
My baby was admitted to the paediatric ward at 3 months old following an episode where I was worried about her breathing.  
She was born at 35 weeks and I had been exclusively breastfeeding her. Her weight gain had been slow but before I went into the hospital no one had raised any concerns with her weight or feeding. Once In the ward the staff made inappropriate comments about my baby's weight, referring to her as scrawny. As a new mum I found this really distressing and a really unkind way to describe my baby. I was advised that I would get breastfeeding support from the infant feeding team but they never came and the breast pump for expressing which was advised by the drs never arrived either  
I felt like I was being pressured to bottle feed my baby despite wishing to breastfeed. I felt like what I was not doing enough for my baby and I didn’t receive any support to continue feeding whilst I was an inpatient. It felt like some of the staff really didn’t have the right knowledge and understanding of breastfeeding. I really wanted to breastfeed her and following my discharge home when all tests had shown no concerns the support I got from breastfeeding support in the community was amazing. However my confidence had already been knocked.  
I had a second admission where again her weight was constantly seen as the focus of our admission when it was her breathing I was concerned about.  
Again I felt undermined and pressured into bottle feeding. I was told if she didn’t put on a certain amount of weight in a few days then I would be admitted to the ward for a week! Still I saw no one in the ward to support me with a feeding plan that involved breast feeding. She was weighed daily and the stress this caused me was huge.  
Care plans were changed and one dr told me I could go home and another said I had to stay.  
Overall both stays I had in the ward were stressful and emotional. A number of the staff in the ward were lovely and caring however the negative experiences I had really affected my overall experience.

readBy.name: NHS Fife
Fife Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Treyj95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I am grateful to all the staff
body: I came to Craigavon Area Hospital at 4 pm and did not get a bed until 7 pm. I understand however that there were other patients who needed to be seen waiting  in front of me. The staff have been helpful, friendly, kind and answer all my questions. They are extremely hard working but still have a lovely manner about them. I am comfortable in my bed and feel I have privacy to get on with my day in the ward. The food is alright. Yesterday we were given a burger which tasted processed. I feel this is a shame as the food is being paid for but unfortunately it is just not appetising. Overall I am grateful to all the staff who have made my stay in hospital positive. I feel very lucky to have the nurses and doctors here looking after me.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Treyj95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Surgical ward
body:
I came into hospital for a hip replacement and have been impressed with the care at both the pre and post op stages of my care. The staff have been exemplary. They always came back to me if I needed anything and returned to me if I had a query with the answer. They are extremely thorough and hard working. I was lucky to be given a side room on my own which is bright and airy. It has been very hot in the hospital the last few days so a fan would be wonderful as I can become quite uncomfortable in the heat. I feel the nurses and doctors listened to me and communicated my treatment plan in a way which was very clear . They are approachable and I feel the experience in hospital has been positive. My room is clean and comfortable as well.  
Overall I am impressed with the care provided to me and feel lucky to have been so well looked after.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Sharie Lew
authorRole: a service user
title: First class experience
body:
My 9 year old injured his foot. Called NHS 24 and was referred to A&E at Victoria Hospital.  
Thank you to all, Holly and Angela - NHS 24, so professional, polite and helpful throughout our call.  
Thank you to the Nurse Practitioner in A&E, sorry my husband didn’t catch your name, your kindness helped ease the anxieties of a very nervous boy.  
A first class experience from start to finish.

readBy.name: NHS 24
Scottish Government
NHS Fife
Fife Health & Social Care Partnership

author: hydrakx38
authorRole: a service user
title: We still have not heard anything
body: My son cannot breath through his nose and has not been able to sleep at night for the last 5 months. He was was seen by his GP who was of the opinion that he has adenoids and needs urgent referral to ENT. After about 2 months still not heard anything. When we enquired we found out that ENT has written back to GP that they don’t need to see him as he is being seen by respiratory physician. This is, however, regarding his pectus excavatum and not regarding his adnoids. There has been no communication with us regarding our son which left us feeling very frustrated about not being able to help him. We have tried to seek advice elsewhere in the UK but this was very difficult due to COVID. Our son continues to suffer being not able to sleep at night and being tired and unsettled during the day. We are desperate to find a solution even if it means travelling elsewhere to have him assessed by an ENT specialist and have his adenoids removed if necessary.

readBy.name: NHS Lothian
Healthcare Improvement Scotland

author: Chafs65
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Well looked after
body:
I have been very well looked after during my time here.  
The staff were brilliant in the induction room but it was far too warm. It was like a sauna. In the delivery suite, the staff all kept me at ease and the doctors were brilliant and kept me well informed in terms of what was happening. The midwife that was with me was Emma and she was amazing throughout.The temperature in this ward is alright and it really helps having a fan especially with the hot weather outside.  
The food is grand and the toilets are spotless. The bed is comfy enough as far as hospital beds go.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Rhiyj26
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My experience in Gynaecology
body: The staff are excellent, everyone from the doctors and nurses to the ladies who clean. They keep me well informed, speak to me in a way that I can understand and make me feel comfortable asking questions. Moreover, they are very patient. The room I am in is very clean and the fact I have an ensuite is a godsend. I had a very long wait in A& E which was made more uncomfortable by the hard chairs, however I was offered drinks of water. The food is okay and there is reasonable  choice on the menu. Improvements I'd like to see would be more comfortable seating in casualty and triage and a reduction in waiting times.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: saturnxc84
authorRole: the patient
title: My trip to Emergency Department
body: I have found my experience of the Emergency Department here at Daisy Hill to be very good. All the staff here are completely dead-on and excellent at what they do - I could not fault them one bit.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: septembercw97
authorRole: the patient
title: My time in the ED
body: My time in Daisy Hill Hospital's Emergency Department has been good.   The staff have been absolutely brilliant and excellent - they couldn't do enough for me. Whether that be bringing me to the toilet or making sure I got all the tests I needed. I have no improvements to suggest - well done to all the staff!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Chafs65
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Keep me well informed
body:
Unfortunately I fell down the stairs as I lost my balance and hit my head. I was worried as I have a brain tumour.  
I cannot praise the paramedics enough. The two men were superb in every single way. The way they handled everything and the way they spoke to me was just amazing. They were so reassuring and put me at ease. I felt so safe with them. I cannot thank them enough.  
I was brought into 3 South. I was woken up at about 3.30am with someone shouting in my ear that I need to be moved straight away because there was a VIP coming in and they needed my ensuite. They said I had to be moved instantly. I didn't really mind but it was a bit of a shock being woke up for that.  
This ward that I am on now is spotless. It is too warm but that is expected when it is very warm outside.  
The food is fine and there is enough variety on the menu.  
The nurses and doctors are pleasant and keep me well informed. I feel comfortable asking them questions.  
I could not fault anyone or anything so far.  
Thank you to everyone that has helped me.

readBy.name: Northern Ireland ambulance service
Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Rhiyj26
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff have been amazing
body: The staff in 2 West Maternity, Craigavon have been amazing, so good and I've been looked after so well. The ward is clean, I get enough privacy and the noise isn't too bad. However, not being able to have a visitor feels wrong, I can't imagine how difficult it would be for someone having their first child. At times like these you need someone there for you to help support you. Furthermore, due to ban on visiting no one is able to call to the shop and bring in necessities or snacks to people on the ward who don't feel up to going to the shop, it would be nice to have someone who could call down and grab a few things for people.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: tryingourbest
authorRole: a parent/guardian
title: Failure to help our daughter
body:
I am writing to you to highlight a lack of mental health support and help for our daughter.  
Our daughter is 11 years old. We as parents had noticed a few years ago that she displayed certain traits that raised concerns and after researching concluded that she exhibited clear defined signs of Asperger's Syndrome / ASD.  
We were referred by our local GP in 2019 and received an initial appointment a few months later with a nurse as part of the assessment phase, we were advised that she agreed that our daughter fitted the profile of potentially being on the spectrum and we would now be put on the waiting list for diagnosis.  
During the first lockdown my daughter suffered increased anxiety, being an only child she was isolated and it was extremely hard for her. Her autism, entwined with anxiety increased in symptoms.  
This severely affected my daughter's mental health and set her way back in comparison to her peers and school. Despite repeated requests, we feel there was no school work or effort made by the school due to my daughter not having an official diagnoses and we as parents were treated as overly concerned parents as they said she was fine in school, despite us explaining she was masking.  
She transitioned into primary six in August and managed 1-3 days a week of school, due to anxiety, separation anxiety and stress leading to poor sleep and health, depression and school refusal. Still we received no help from the school or CAMHS.  
Second lock down in January and schools closed again, winter, children not going outside created the perfect storm for her, her anxiety increased her stress and worries all increased with COVID and lock down put her mental health in a spiralling downward slope. She was having multiple panic attacks daily, refusing to wash, barely eating, her sensory issues were off the scales, her nightmares and inability to sleep increased. She says she just wants to die, that she’s sad and doesn’t know why. She is depressed. At ten year old she wanted to kill herself. She has run out of the house, a moving car down the street or when stressed hits her head against a wall repeatedly.  
The only thing we could do was remove her from school all together (removing the main stressor) for her mental well-being and at a waiting time of 95 weeks for diagnoses within CAMHS we begged and borrowed the money to have her assessed privately (£1500 for a family on benefits at that point).  
This helped with school as they were harassing us and not willing to understand that she was suffering – why, because until then we were still waiting for the NHS to help us.  
Through her sessions with a private therapist it has come to light that she has profiles of PDA and ADHD as well as the ASD she was originally diagnosed with. She will rarely leave the house, has full blown panic attacks where she cannot breathe, will not be in a room alone the whole family have now been sleeping in the same room for months (we are still waiting for a sleep referral made over 70 weeks ago). She continues to be terrified of any flying animal (except birds) so barely manages to get out with the dogs, and if she does I end up carrying her or she clings to me. She forces herself out of the house with me because cannot bear to be apart from me at all, for any length of time.. If she needs the toilet, I must go with her. She pulls her hair out in clumps at the smallest worry. Any illness she hears about sends her into a panic. Socialising is exhausting, even seeing her cousins fills her with anxiety that is paralysing. Her sensitivity to paper has increased, this includes paper straws, toilet paper (we make washable toilet cloths). She is scared of us leaving her. She barely washes, brushes her teeth or trims her nails. She is easily distracted, needs to move constantly and… her world is shrinking daily, she is lonely and feels she is not understood.  
Her father and I do all we can, read, joined parent groups but do not possess the specialist skills needed to help her. We are both on anti-depressants. Her father has attempted suicide. Our family is being torn apart. Following a complaint we made we had a call from an occupational therapist 5 weeks ago, who tried to tell me that they didn’t think CAMHS was a suitable fit for her at the moment, that we should see an OT, that they would chase the sleep referral and also refer us to the Strathclyde Autistic Society. Also if I sent in the private diagnoses report that she would verify it. I pushed for her to see CAMHS. She needs to see a psychotherapist and potentially have therapy with medication. We have heard nothing since.  
With the NHS failing to see my daughter, she has missed essentially a whole year of school, has become increasingly isolated and has anxiety issues that are heart breaking to watch.  
We have been put into debt to pay for private treatment , I had to stop being my husband and daughters carer and forced back to full time work which has put a tremendous strain on our family, as my husband is disabled retired.  
We would like to see my daughter grow up to be the vibrant happy person she used to be, not another statistic of those we lose, and we do lose them, without appropriate help, all too often girls lose their lives through chronic depression, eating disorders, miss-understood melt-downs.  
We know early intervention is key to a happy long life. Our daughter needs professional help and she needs it now, as she develops her sense of self, before her world shrinks further and her autism, anxiety and depression impact her further and for longer.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
NHS Greater Glasgow & Clyde
Scottish Government
St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students
Sheffield University Medical School 2021
Healthcare Improvement Scotland
Time to Change - Wales

author: Rhiyj26
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Experience in MLU
body: My experience in the Midwifery Led Unit in Craigavon Area Hospital has been overall positive. The staff have been great, especially midwives Karina and student midwife Rebekah were excellent. I had been slightly apprehensive going to the MLU as I had never been there before, but it is a more relaxed atmosphere than the delivery suite and they gave you time to chill with the baby before taking you away to get stitches etc. The room and facilities have been clean, tidy and easy to use. The food has been great and we've been well looked after.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: JF2019
authorRole: the patient
title: An outstanding service
body: I joined this practice, as a patient, in 2015 after transferring from Wendover Partnership. Throughout my dealings with them, I've never encountered any difficulties or issues that have had a dramatic disadvantage to my health. Moreover, the practice has been rather over-helpful. Granted, I have had a run-in with one or two of the staff on reception in the past, but following a conversation with their Patient Services Manager, things dramatically improved. I've never been given any real reason to submit a formal complaint, however, on the odd occasion, when I was having significant difficulties, the Patient Services Manager and Operation Manager were always willing to listen and resolve any and all issues to my satisfaction. More recently, I've seen crtiticisms of the practice, however, this has never stopped me from receiving an outstanding service.

author: Chafs65
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Midwifery led unit
body:
I am very happy will all of the care that I have received. I have no complaints at all.  
My midwife was absolutely amazing.  
All of the midwives were very helpful. I can just press the buzzer and they come straight away. They all explained everything and kept me fully at ease.  
This room was really cold this morning, even my baby was shivering. It is getting warmer as the day goes on.  
Everything was very clean when I arrived.  
The food that I have had was lovely. They were good portion sizes and there was plenty of choice on the menu.  
Thank you so much to all of the midwives that have made my experience so positive.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Public Health Agency

author: L0209
authorRole: a service user
title: Covid vaccination
body: Due to a health condition I had to be referred to the high risk clinic to recurve my first vaccination- to get to this stage was a bit frustrating however once I was managed to speak with someone at public health I was contacted by the nurse in charge of the clinic. On the day she made me feel relaxed despite being in my local A+E at the Victoria Hospital for the clinic. I had to be observed for 30min and in this time the nurse and nursing assistant made me feel comfortable. I was then contacted a few days after to see how I had been and then a few days after that to let me know the specialist panels decision on where I should get my second vaccination. I have just received my second vaccination today (17th July) in a community setting however I had to phone for an appointment and was told I must have gotten lost in the system due to going from one pathway to another. The nurses and the nursing assistants today at Carnegie Campus were second to none and made me feel at ease. Despite a few hiccups along the way in receiving my vaccination I would like to commend the high-risk clinic at the Victoria Hospital Kirkcaldy and all the staff at the Carnegie Campus for the work they are doing.

readBy.name: NHS Fife
NHS National Services Scotland
Fife Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Rhiyj26
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Really high standards
body: My experience in 1 North Craigavon Area Hospital has been really quite lovely. I have enjoyed interacting with ladies on the ward. The treatment, service and hospitality has been of really high standards. The building is great, the ward is painted well and bright, however is can feel stuffy which makes it hard to breathe, it would help if the windows could open better. I've been in hospital for 2 or 3 days and have yet to see a doctor, they organised for me to get an x-ray but I have yet to see them. The food is very good, you are given far too much. The facilities are of very high standard as well.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Rhiyj26
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Very professional
body: Everything so far has been good. The staff are very patient and very professional, they communicate well and keep me well informed. The staff in 2 North spoiled me, everything was spot on and very clean. I'd like to see improvements on A& E waiting times and a more comfortable waiting area. However from then on everything has been fine.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Chafs65
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: They keep me well updated
body:
I am being very well treated. I couldn't say a word against any staff.  
They keep me well updated and everyone is doing a wonderful job. The food is good.  
The ward is very warm but pulling the blinds down helps a lot so the sun isn't shining in. Otherwise it would be roasting.  
I have no complaints at all.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Chafs65
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Staff were great
body:
The staff have been really good and attentive. The doctors keep me well informed and have been around every day to check on me. I feel comfortable asking them questions and they answer them well.  
I was on 2 North for 2 weeks and the staff were great there too.The ward is quite warm but when the windows are open it is ok.  
I could not think of any improvements to make.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Rhiyj26
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Good communication
body: I have been well looked after in craigavon area hospital, the nurses are great, they listen to well and communicate well. The doctors and nurses are gifted to do what they do. Accident and emergency was bedlam, some people weren't seen until the next morning. The staff there were very pleasant, they gave me water and made me comfortable. In 1 North the facilities are good, the food is good, there's good choice. My room is clean and the bed is as comfy as it can be.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: maywr33
authorRole: a service user
title: Welcomed distractions
body:
The doctors wanted me to get a bit more help with things.  
I worked with Tony and charlotte they gave me some things to try to help me get better. Tony told me to put the T.V on for some background sounds and Charlotte asked if I like to read books and said I could do that.  
They help me with things to do.

readBy.name: Nottinghamshire Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Lib673kdjhe
authorRole: a service user
title: So impressed
body: Just had my second vaccination, so impressed with the SSE Arena facility, very efficient and all staff are very kind and and professional. Thank you to all involved.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: earthkh43
authorRole: a service user
title: Attending vaccine with young baby
body: We had a fantastic experience at the Covid vaccine Centre at the SSE arena mid July. I was very nervous about going with my baby but staff were so helpful (without me needing to ask) and made so many accommodations for us, including a nurse showing me where I could breastfeed if needed. I couldn't fault any part of my experience

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Reeta
authorRole: a service user
title: Reception staff
body:
Brought my 2 year old with a very high fever. Had been crying after initial assessment. At reception we were asked one question then the staff member proceeded to do some paperwork. After a few minutes they gave me a piece of paper & ushered me away. Asked where I should go, they rudely pointed to a door & shouted at me. I said you just need to tell me where to go, and they proceeded to get very aggressive & angry. Walked into Paediatric Care. My toddler had been crying throughout. He's not normally like that. Saw the nurses who were lovely. Asked them if my husband could come in so we could both attend to our soon, they agreed. The staff member on reception wouldn't let him in, the nurse had to go outside & get my husband. The reception staff member then came into the waiting area & demanded that my husband leave. The nurse said it was ok, but they continued to shout.  
I understand that there are policies in place due to covid but there was another child with two people with him, so why can't my husband help?  
Not what you need when you have a very poorly child.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

author: couragepq53
authorRole: the patient
title: My hospital stay in Female Surgical
body: I came to Daisy Hill Hospital initially through the Emergency Department following a fall.   It took a reasonable amount of time before being called, however, once there I was well treated, my bloods done and I was swiftly moved up to the ward. All the nurses have been very friendly, helpful and quick.   Anytime I need anything, I can easily buzz for a nurse and they are straight their to help me with whatever I need.   I haven't found anything wrong with my hospital stay - everything so far has been nothing but good!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Mk81
authorRole: the patient
title: Childhood Trauma
body: I feel that therapy really helped me put alot of things in perspective.. For many years I was completely lost and had no hope in my life... I have hope now which I'm very thankful for .. I'm also planning my future and setting myself goals... I could never have made sense of anything without the therapy. I highly recommend therapy for anyone who is where I was.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: inspirehx85
authorRole: the patient
title: Lovely & Accommodating Staff
body:
I came to Daisy Hill Hospital after having a fall. I originally did not think it was that serious, however I later got worse and phoned for an ambulance.  
The waiting times for an ambulance were far too long - 220 minutes for an ambulance to Craigavon and 62 minutes for an ambulance to Daisy Hill Hospital. This was too long a wait for me so I was driven up to the hospital by a family member.  
In A&E I only had to stay in the waiting room for 20 minutes, which I found to be very efficient. I was then quickly given a scan where a clot was found in my chest. I found the whole emergency department to be very quick and responsive - with my bloods done and results back within an hour. The doctor treating me was very kind and explained everything to me that I needed to know.  
Up on the Female Surgical Ward the staff have also been brilliant. The doctors and nurses have all been lovely as well as accommodating towards me. I especially like how all the nurses, even those not directly responsible for my care, would pop their heads in to introduce themselves. I find it reassuring knowing the names and faces of all those taking care of me. The staff have always made me feel very comfortable and are always there if I need anything at all.  
I only have two minor areas which I think would make an improvement to my overall hospital visit. Firstly, I feel there should be more vending machines closer to the wards, as it can be a very long trip down to the ground floor shop - especially if you're only after surgery. Secondly, I have noticed a lot of noise/family members coming in at night. It would be nicer if the doors could be closed just to give a bit more peace and quiet as well as a bit of privacy.  
Overall, I am happy enough with my hospital stay here at Daisy Hill Hospital.

readBy.name: Northern Ireland ambulance service
Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: whisperrr45
authorRole: the patient
title: No complaints about A&E
body: I was taken to the Emergency Department at Daisy Hill Hospital today and my overall experience has been quite good -I honestly have no complaints. The department is a bit busy but what can you do - the Doctors and Nurses are all doing their absolute best. All the staff here are excellent, caring and kind. Of course everybody would like to see improvements in terms of waiting times etc. , especially in these testing times, but I can clearly see that everyone is doing their upmost best to get through the large workload. Good job all staff members!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great practice
body:
Good GP reception staff are hard to find but not in this surgery.
They are always very helpful & polite.
The GP’s are excellent. 
I would highly recommend.

author: Rhiyj26
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Makes me feel at home
body: Everything is lovely. I like joking around with the staff and they joke back with you it makes me feel at home. The food is really good, you get a menu sheet and there is good choice and the bed is comfy. There is always staff about who are very very good at looking after you. Dr Bheutta is a lovely jolly man.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: caringzs57
authorRole: the patient
title: An interesting stay in hospital
body: I would describe my stay in Daisy Hill Hospital as an interesting one.   I came into the hospital firstly through the Emergency Department.   All the ED staff were very caring and attentive, but also very busy.   I can say nothing bad whatsoever about it.   Moving on up to the ward the staff again have been excellent.   However, since they were so busy, I have had to be moved around a couple of times, which I understand due to the understaffing, finally ending up on male surgical.   In terms of staff, I have found the student nurses to be very caring - they take note of everything and are very pleasant to be around.   I would rate  staff 110% with all the staff being very caring, attentive and cheerful. Any problems I might have, the staff will easily sort them for me.   I have no improvements to offer - just keep doing what you're doing!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Public Health Agency

author: Rhiyj26
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Not too busy
body: My stay has been pretty good so far. The ladies in here work their socks off, they work so hard and have no energy. I have been really well looked after. The food is dead on, the tea is good. The ward is quiet it isn't too busy.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Chafs65
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Everyone is lovely
body:
I came into the emergency department but the air conditioning had broken so it was roasting. I had to wait 12 hours before getting a bed, I was brought into a tiny room with no windows with no air-conditioning so it wasn't great. The young nurses in the emergency department earn their money. They are so busy but amazing. They're rushed but still get to every patient.  
I really can't complain about being here. Everyone is lovely, however I haven't seen a doctor today. I feel like I have to ask to find out most of the information I need as they don't keep me well updated.I do understand what they tell me but I have to ask them the same question twice to make sure.The ward is cleaned 3 times a day which is nice to see. It is very warm. We aren't allowed to use fans but we really need them. The food is excellent.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent service
body: I made a same day telephone appointment  which lead to a Drs appointment and hospital federal for a scan .all within the same day.i felt safe and respected.could not ask for a better gp pravtice

title: Poor practice
body:
Impossible to get to see a doctor. Even before covid. 
Not at understanding of me being a nurse in nhs and needing to see a doctor.

title: Reassuring service
body: An appointment was offered at short notice.  Good COVID safety measures were in place.  We were in for our appointment within 20 minutes if the appointment time and we’re listened to and offered a plan for treatment we were comfortable with.

title: Unfortunate degradation of patient care
body: After many years attending the best patient centred practice I have ever experienced the recent changes have resulted in a typical business centred practice. No doubt it is very advantageous to the doctors if a patient spends 22 mins on hold rather than talking to them. By the time I decided to give up, my ailment had changed from my foot to my arm caused by holding my phone for so long. I will try again forlornly tomorrow but after 3 months of pain rather than taking a doctors time I consider myself to have been foolish. Had I started 3 months ago I may have been seen by now

author: Chafs65
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Dedicated to the job
body:
All of the staff are very good and kind. They look after me well and are very helpful. They have always got me anything that I need. They are very busy but I can see that they are all very dedicated to the job.  
The food is lovely, especially the curry and the vegetable soup. They're just delicious.  
It is far far too warm in here. We aren't allowed fans and I'm constantly sweating.  
The ward is regularly cleaned and it always looks spotless.  
It is really sad that I can't see any of my family members due to no visiting being allowed. It gets really lonely in here.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Professional. Caring. Compassionate
body: In the literal sense they saved my life. Expert diagnosis and referrals meant critical issues dealt with quickly and very successfully. Superb team who work together. Thank you for being you :-)

title: Helpful support
body: I found my telephone sessions to be a very useful check-in during my recovery, the worksheets provided are still a helpful to me months down the line, would highly recommend for anyone needing extra support with their mental health.

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust o

author: Chafs65
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My stay has been great
body:
My stay has been great. All of the staff are always there when you need them. They are so helpful.  
There is a high standard in this hospital with everything including care, food and cleanliness.  
The doctors are brilliant and keep me well informed on my condition.  
I can just see that all of the staff work so hard for their patients. The sweat is pouring off them because it is so warm but yet they don't let this affect them.  
The food is brilliant here especially the apple tart and custard.  
The place is always spotless so I'm not worried about any infections going around.  
I have no complaints at all. I am very happy here.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Neurologist did not keep my appointment!
body:
I received a confirmation on my appointment by text, after having waited for several months. I waited for three hour but the neurologist never rang. I rang to find out the reason and was told they are very busy and that the note said: they could not make contact with me. My wife and I were both in all the time. The operator also confirmed that she could not offer me another appointment as I was a new patient! She confirmed both my contact numbers to be correct. 
People do not know what NHS is like until they actually need the service. Why can't unsatisfied patients get their money back and  go privately if they wish?

readBy.name: Princess Alexandra Hospital NHS Trust

title: Pointless and uncaring
body: I struggle to recall a time when this place has been welcoming or pleasant. The standard advice for a medical problem has always been "go home and take some paracetamol", no interest in helping people unless they have private cover - they then jump on the chance to shift the work to someone else. Appalling customer service, good luck to anyone trying to get an appointment! From my own experience, it's a building filled with people just logging their hours and getting paid for doing as little as possible. I wouldn't be surprised if Google and Amazon have taken over as the most popular healthcare providers in the area!

title: Excellent service
body: I have been having district nurses for 4 months and I can honestly say they are a credit to your service always a smile and professional. Explained everything and nothing ever a problem for them. I will certainly miss them

readBy.name: Kent Community Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Telephone answer machine
body: Waited 47minutes in queue-line went dead,this has happened several times. Called back been number 1 in queue for 39mins total of 2hours and 20mins still no answer -impossible to get through. Econsult problems with computer system ,not good enough and does not help if receptionist not friendly as some are abrupt. Practice Manager please review ASAP these ladies are doing there best. Concern for those less able-need to improve to help public and services

title: worst service
body: I have visited the three times same department in this month, every time they made me wait for 7 to 8 hours. I am afraid why can't they understand women with 35 plus weeks pregnancy can't sit that much longer hours. I felt every time it is completely waste of time to visit the department, They are not ready to listen to the patient's fears and concerns. I am so much disappointed and felt very pity on me because I am going to give birth to my child in this hospital.

title: Great practice
body: I dont understand how any body can not have the highest respect for this surgery .In the 58 years i have been on this planet i have never found a surgery that has been so dedicated to helping thire patients.To all my brothers and sisters at the surgery you do a fantastic job and i thank you for keeping me healthy and fit

title: Strongly Recommend
body: I told my therapist during our first session that I was cynical about talking therapy and doubtful that it would be useful or helpful for me. However, she remained helpful, approachable and non-judgmental throughout our sessions, and everything was taken at my own pace and with my needs or concerns at the forefront. In spite of my cynicism, my practitioner taught me several techniques, which were and are incredibly useful and have been helpful.  Further,  she was in particular an insightful and friendly voice on the other end of the phone, and I found that I was actively looking forward to my sessions. I feel like a different person having coming out of the process, and with each session -  no matter how bad I was feeling before - I finished feeling slightly better, relieved and listened to. Having her there was a gift.

readBy.name: South London and Maudsley NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Eye Care Hospital
body: Everyone from the person greeting you when you enter the hospital who checks you in, the receptionists, nurses, doctors, consultants and surgeons, they all treat you with respect and as a person with feelings, and who may be nervous of not knowing what is likely to happen, using their excellent knowledge and training. An organisation I continually recomend to my family and friends.

title: Cancer patient - communication breakdown
body:
I need to do my cancer routine check and simple I can't have it cause of miscommunication with the doctor and stuff. All my body is in pain and I have to wait weeks in order to have simple blood test. The front office or doctors cannot receive any emails or letters from my surgeon on Chelsea hospital. So that means every time I have to walk there and pass them the letters they should receive weeks ago. Then I will have to wait 1-2 weeks to get an appointment and ask the doctor to prescribe me my scheduled check ups. The doctor will prescribed me the wrong blood check which means another 2 week delay till I find that out. Then I have to pick up again the blood form and book a new blood test .Then for some reason the lab fails to produce the right blood test which means have to book another appointment with the doctor ask for a new blood test and so on. So far I have gave blood 2 times and still they don't produce the right test. The doctor has admitted that there is a problem there and he said will try to find out why this keeps happening and will let me know. 1 week already passed and I have no idea what is going on. Again I have to through the procedure. Ofcourse I will not get any notification if the doctor had prescribed me a new blood test. Either I have to guess it or book and appointment in the next 2 weeks. 
I am already stressed about my health and they make me even worst. I am so tired of the idea  I have to ask for 10 appointments to schedule a check up that should be scheduled already. Nobody can do anything about not receiving any updates from other hospitals. I have checked my details from both sides and are correct. The doctors will not contact you or you will not get any notification that your blood form should be picked up , you have to spend hours on the line to book an appointment . I don't know from where to ask help really it's so frustrating. Front desk really tries to help you but cannot fix everything they have a ceiling.

title: Caring staff
body: We were visiting Frinton on Saturday when my mother was taken ill with severe abdominal pain. We called an ambulance that arrived within 15 minutes. Both ambulance staff were calm and reassuring and attended my mum with great care. I was able to go with her to Colchester hospital and they kept other family members outside updated before we left. They monitored her on the way and then took her into the rapid response unit. After a while i was able to join mum in a cubicle. We were seen by many different people including nurses, doctors and surgeons and i cannot praise highly enough every single member of staff that attended us. I observed that they were rushed off their feet but made you feel as though you were their only patient. After receiving treatment we were fortunately able to leave with medication and full information about what we needed to do next.  I realise that the staff there have had such a difficult time and work hard all the time but i just wanted to let them know how much we appreciated what they did for us.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: FABULOUS
body:
I attended A&E just before 8am on a Monday morning.  I was greeted by a very pleasant gentleman who took my details then directed me to minor injuries.  On arrival I was greeted by another pleasant gentleman who took all my history and I explained the reason for my attendance there.  I was examined and then sent for an x-ray.  The radiologist was a young blonde lady who immediately put me at ease and explained the whole procedure.  I returned to minor injuries and was called back in in less than ten minutes.  I was reassured my injury was nothing major and my x-ray was clear.  I was given the appropriate advice and then discharged.  I was back at my desk within an hour of arriving at A&E.

The whole experience, although not what I wanted to have, was pleasant and all staff are a credit to WHH.  Thanks so much

readBy.name: North Cheshire Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Great experience
body:
Well sign posted directions, easy check in.
Que system worked well, seen within 5 minutes.
Vaccination explained and administered effectively.
Great experience

title: Cataracts for both eyes
body: From start to finish Spa Medica Coventry were professional, attentive and clinically excellent. COVID precautions we’re also excellent

title: Poor care
body: Care at Stenhouse is getting worse,, pandemic is no excuse. Always have to call but phone lines are rubbish. Get cut off by reception even before I answer. Cannot see GPs and list goes on. It seems they were last inspected by CQC few years and is long overdue,,going to move to another local practice

title: Don’t waste your time
body: Being over the phone it’s hard to explain what the problem is especially when it’s to do with the joints , I got told I would need a blood test for the problem which is fine but when it’s followed up with it will come back clear  because I had one few months prior but we just do one anyways. So my bloods came back clear , I had to ring them to find out , so I rebook an appointment because the problem is still there that’s all fine , comes to the day of the appointment and no one calls so I call the surgery for them to tell me I’m inactive patient and have been since June so nothing was put through  . But how can I book the appointment I’m July if I’m inactive and surely they should have told me when I booked the appointment.they still haven’t given me a response on why this has happened . Won’t be wasting any more time here  and I’d advise everyone to avoid

title: Unethical 2 tier access
body:
Told the day before to phone at 8am for urgent appointments. Phone engaged at 8am. Got through at 8:04 and all appointments gone. Patient is a complex cancer patient who wants to see a doctor who knows them but told can go to a walk in centre or ring after lunch as there might be something later. Asked why all appointments gone in 4 minutes told it's people booking via online access. After asking to speak to the practice manager, ( you can't, you have to email!) Given a telephone appointment (early morning,  not a time), for a week's time. No provision for those without online access to even complain directly. This 2 tier access is unethical. 
Doctors are usually great, when you can get access to them.

readBy.name: Healthwatch Tameside

title: What happened??
body: I have been with PMG for quite some time and I have generally considered the service to be excellent. However, in the last year or so PGM has taken a huge nose dive. The online system is unintuitive and asks irrelevant sub questions to many of the main questions. I’m very computer literate but I hate to think what someone with difficulties would do. So…then I have to phone the surgery as it all goes wrong. I was met with a rather rude call handler who’s attitude was appalling and I was left feeling devalued and upset. She offered to input my details again otherwise I couldn’t have phone call from a doctor. Why? Why can’t I ask for an appointment or call back with a doctor without the unnecessary business of listing all of my symptoms to a receptionist. General Practitioner means just that, I shouldn’t have to refer myself to a specialist via the online system (or with a call handler that sighs and gives the distinct impression they don’t want to be there). If you do get spoken to by a doctor quite quickly, then good for you, but don’t undermine other people’s legitimate complaints because this has happened to me every time I have tried to use the service and it seems that it has happened to a lot more people as well!!

title: Great Service
body: Easy to book, friendly and pleasant reception. Made a bad situation manageable. Very happy with overall experience. Would recommend.

title: Great practice
body: As soon as you walked in very helpfull and friendly had banged my big toe and nail was loose the nurses were very attentive and put me at ease a doctor then came in and took my nail off my experience was very chilled with every thing going on at the moment my treatment was brilliant from start to finish thankyou

title: Great Practice
body: Having used the new online system recently I have to say that I am very impressed with the efficiency so far and hope that it continues.

title: Comforting consultation!
body: I found my medical consultation, very reassuring, and very helpful,all my questions was covered, making me feel better in myself ,and also giving me new information in caring and well being of myself,thankyou for the experience, I look forward for my next medical review!!

title: Great practice
body:
I went to the surgery to have my Hormone injection
For my prostrate cancer.The Doctor was very helpful and professional.He also saw my wife without having an appointment for her ankle and back pain
We have been with the practice for the last 32 years
We would recommend the practice

title: Great experience
body: Was a very good visit, very professional and kind and courteous staff who put you at ease when you visit

title: This is a very good practice
body: I have been a patient here for very many years. I have always had very good treatment delivered with kindness and care. In this covid situation I have always been able to access medical advice, attentive and treatment if needed.  All of the staff are committed to providing high quality care.

title: Good doctors practice.
body: I never seem to have any personal problems with this Doctors Twickenham Rd. Always been able to get my appointments on time"And get prompt ring back!from  doctors !!!

title: Helpful, efficient and caring staff
body: I have recently registered with this practice after being recommended them by a neighbour, having just moved to the area. So far I have found everyone I have spoken to be really helpful and reassuring, and I wouldn't hesitate to also recommend them to others.

title: Awful experience made good!
body:
I had a colonoscopy and although the experience was not very pleasant, the staff were fantastic. Very caring and helpful. They made what could have been an dreadful time bearable.
I cant praise them enough.
Thank you very much.

readBy.name: Northumbria Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Lovely caring staff. Efficient practice
body: Rang reception at 14 32, call back from Gp within 3 minutes and was sitting in with the nurse 10 minutes later. Brilliant service and kind caring staff. Very lucky to have this practice in the village. Thank you.

title: appalling self-serving
body: if you fancy a quaint country practice... great , if you want to be listened to, treated with respect, treated at all.. then go somewherre else. The satff are all about themselves. there is no courtesy, no understanding, no efficiency. They are too busy chatting amongst themselves to respond. phone calls are not returned. trying to access a GP and get treatment is like jumping through rings of fire. Thery pay no attention to information given numerous times. they get it wrong and try to blame the patient. they are incapable of acknowledging their mistakes and they put nothing in place to ensure that you are treated any better the next time. do not go here if you are in need of treatment the only thing it is good for is the view.

title: Used to be great
body: Since the privatisation of this practice it has become unrecognisable. Cannot get through on the phone unless I take 1-2 hours away from work which unfortunately just isn't possible. Due to this we cannot get appointments, for ourselves or our 5 month old baby. When we have managed to get through most of the time the staff have been rude. I had an appointment booked (telephone), they made one attempt to contact at which time I happened to be feeding the baby. They left a voicemail saying they wouldn't be trying again and I would need to ring up to be relisted. This has caused us to suffer with illnesses without assessment or treatment. I intent on taking this complaint further
